item.title: Commands. (solved)
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

Jmood:

you may have messed with the brackets of another command and have now made it so multiple commands are considered a single block in the method. Please post your command class here. As a suggestion you should use an IDE, it would help you greatly in developing and clear away a lot of simple mistakes that turn into massive headaches.

yeah i should start using it.
ive fixed it anyway, i just got the original command and made a few changes, and all the commands word perfectly.
thank you guys

Read full topic

if this } doesnt fix it do you know what could be the case?

item.title: Commands. (solved)
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:523806”]Your changepass command doesn’t work because it isn’t set up right.

Try this one:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("changepassword") && playerCommand.length() > 14) {
    String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
     c.playerPass = args[1];
     c.sendMessage("Your password is now: " + c.playerPass);        
}

As for your kbd, make sure you aren’t adding it in an if statement that looks like this:

if(c.playerRights >= 4){
}

or similar.[/quote]

i tried that code you sent me for the changepassword command but when i type changepassword example nothing happens tried logging out and nothing.

as for kdr i didnt have the statement, at first i was.

if (playercommand.startsWith(“kdr”))
without the && c.playerRights

Read full topic

item.title: Commands. (solved)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Your changepass command doesn’t work because it isn’t set up right.

Try this one:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("changepassword") && playerCommand.length() > 14) {
    String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
     c.playerPass = args[1];
     c.sendMessage("Your password is now: " + c.playerPass);        
}

As for your kbd, make sure you aren’t adding it in an if statement that looks like this:

if(c.playerRights >= 4){
}

or similar.

Read full topic

item.title: Commands. (solved)
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

Jmood:

You might as remove the playerRights condition from the kdr command since it’s isn’t needed. As for the changepassword command does it use the forceChat method?

i had it without the playerRights and it still didnt work for some reason but ill check again.

this is my changepassword command, and i just remembered, it does the same thing with ::explock ::unlock too

if (playerCommand.startsWith("changepassword") && playerCommand.length() > 15) { c.playerPass = playerCommand.substring(15); c.sendMessage("Your password is now: " + c.playerPass);

Read full topic

item.title: Commands. (solved)
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

for some reason some of the commands you have to be owner to use them but i have set them so anyone can use them for example “kdr”, i have use the ::kdr command on my main account but on my pure for some reason it doesnt let you do the command.

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“kdr”) && c.playerRights >= 0) {
double KDR = ((double)c.KC)/((double)c.DC);
c.forcedChat(“My Kill/Death ratio is “+c.KC+”/”+c.DC+"; “+KDR+”.");

			}
		}[code]

also, with some of the other commands for example ::changepassword

in chat it will come up with;
pure acc:gepassword example
your password is example[/code]

Read full topic
